konaneCommon
Class Move

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--konaneCommon.Move
public class Move
extends java.lang.Object

A move on a Konane gameboard.

The Move class represents a move from an initial position to a final position on a BoardGrid. A position is defined by its row and column, numbered beginning with 0, as described in BoardGrid. The move also records to which side it belongs, black or white; sides are defined as byte constants in Konane. Finally, the move includes an optional comment as a String. You may use this comment to debug your algorithm, baffle your friends, and confound your enemies! Comments can be made visible during the tournament at the organizers' discretion.

Version:
1.14, 17 January 2001
Author:
Paul Pham

Constructor Detail

Move

public Move(int initialCol,
            int initialRow,
            int finalCol,
            int finalRow,
            byte side,
            java.lang.String comment)
Default constructor that accepts the initial position, final position, and side of a move, along with an optional comment. The positions consist of a column and row number, beginning with 0, as defined in BoardGrid. The side is a byte constant, either Konane.WHITE or Konane.BLACK, indicating to which side the move belongs. The comment is limited to a string of 22 or less characters from [A-Z,a-z,0-9]. Null comments will result in a comment of the empty string.

Returns:
